questions: Q. 1. What is meant by latent heat of fusion ?
answers: Ans. The amount of heat energy that is required to change 1 kg of a solid into liquid at atmospheric pressure at its melting point is known as the latent heat of fusion.

questions: Q. 10. What happens to the boiling point of a liquid when atmospheric pressure decreases ?
answers: Ans. Boiling point decreases because boiling point is the temperature at which vapour pressure of a liquid becomes equal to atmospheric pressure.

questions: Q. 11. What happens to the melting point of ice when pressure is increased ?
answers: Ans. When pressure is applied on the surface of ice, the change into liquid state is assisted. Thus, melting point decreases.
